AUTHOR: Thomas Edison
QUOTE: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.

AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln
QUOTE: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.

AUTHOR: Albert Einstein
QUOTE: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.

AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe
QUOTE: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.

AUTHOR: James M. Barrie
QUOTE: Life is a long lesson in humility.

AUTHOR: Bob Marley
QUOTE: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.

AUTHOR: Ray Bradbury
QUOTE: Life is trying things to see if they work.

AUTHOR: Helen Keller
QUOTE: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.

AUTHOR: John Lennon
QUOTE: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.

AUTHOR: Jonathan Swift
QUOTE: May you live all the days of your life.

AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
QUOTE: If you want to make life easy, make it hard.

AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri
QUOTE: Follow your path, and let the people talk.

AUTHOR: Albert Einstein
QUOTE: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.

AUTHOR: Steve Jobs
QUOTE: If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time.

AUTHOR: Oprah Winfrey
QUOTE: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.

AUTHOR: David Brinkley
QUOTE: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.

AUTHOR: Estee Lauder
QUOTE: I never dreamed about success, I worked for it.

AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau
QUOTE: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.

AUTHOR: Colin Powell
QUOTE: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.

AUTHOR: John D. Rockefeller
QUOTE: The secret of success is to do the common thing uncommonly well.

AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln
QUOTE: The best thing about the future is that it only comes one day at a time.

AUTHOR: Albert Einstein
QUOTE: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.

AUTHOR: Anne Frank
QUOTE: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.

AUTHOR: Aristotle
QUOTE: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.

AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin
QUOTE: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.

AUTHOR: Bruce Lee
QUOTE: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.

AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt
QUOTE: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
QUOTE: Difficulties increase the nearer we get to the goal.

AUTHOR: Michelangelo
QUOTE: Faith in oneself is the best and safest course.

AUTHOR: Sophocles
QUOTE: It takes both sunshine and rain to make a rainbow.

AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi
QUOTE: We must become the change we want to see.

AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
QUOTE: Knowing is not enough; we must apply!

AUTHOR: Immanuel Kant
QUOTE: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

AUTHOR: Indira Gandhi
QUOTE: You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.

AUTHOR: Pierre Auguste Renoir
QUOTE: The pain passes, but the beauty remains.

AUTHOR: Heraclitus
QUOTE: All is flux; nothing stays still.

AUTHOR: Japanese proverb
QUOTE: The day you decide to do it is your lucky day.

AUTHOR: Epictetus
QUOTE: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.

AUTHOR: Cervantes
QUOTE: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.

AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela
QUOTE: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

AUTHOR: Mother Teresa
QUOTE: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

AUTHOR: Mae West
QUOTE: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.

AUTHOR: Hans Christian Andersen
QUOTE: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.

AUTHOR: Walt Disney
QUOTE: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

AUTHOR: William Shakespeare
QUOTE: Having nothing, nothing can he lose.

AUTHOR: Tony Robbins
QUOTE: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.

AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson
QUOTE: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

AUTHOR: Margaret Mead
QUOTE: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.

AUTHOR: J.K. Rowling
QUOTE: When in doubt go to the library.

AUTHOR: Walt Whitman
QUOTE: Keep your face always toward the sunshine and shadows will fall behind you.

AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe
QUOTE: Believe nothing you hear, and only half that you see.

AUTHOR: Romain Rolland
QUOTE: A hero is a man who does what he can.

AUTHOR: Mark Twain
QUOTE: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.

AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin
QUOTE: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

AUTHOR: Albert Einstein
QUOTE: The only thing more dangerous than ignorance is arrogance.

AUTHOR: Marie Curie
QUOTE: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.

AUTHOR: Charles Dickens
QUOTE: A very little key will open a very heavy door.

AUTHOR: Franklin Pierce
QUOTE: If your past is limited, your future is boundless.

AUTHOR: Samuel Johnson
QUOTE: Never trust your tongue when your heart is bitter.

AUTHOR: William James
QUOTE: The good we do today becomes the happiness of tomorrow.

AUTHOR: Rene Descartes
QUOTE: Conquer yourself rather than the world.

AUTHOR: Voltaire
QUOTE: Everything you say should be true, but not everything true should be said.

AUTHOR: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
QUOTE: Silence is the best response to a fool.
